item.title: IBM’s time-series foundation model reaches #2 on GIFT-Eval
item.description: The model uses a state space architecture to outperform time-series models at least 20 times bigger.

item.title: New AI model finds railroad defects before they’re critical
item.description: A new AI model detects and tracks rail maintenance issues before they can cause problems, freeing up skilled workers from tedious inspections.

item.title: IBM and Vanguard explore quantum optimization for finance | IBM Quantum Computing Blog
item.description: Variational quantum algorithms for portfolio optimization.

item.title: How AI alignment differs from AI steering
item.description: IBM Fellow Kush Varshney explains the difference, and provides an update on IBM’s latest work to mitigate the safety risks around generative AI.

item.title: HSBC explores algorithmic trading with IBM quantum computers | IBM Quantum Computing Blog
item.description: Researchers deliver first-known empirical evidence that quantum computers could soon solve valuable problems in algorithmic bond trading.

item.title: IBM and BharatGen collaborate for India’s AI needs
item.description: Using the multimodal AI and LLMs BharatGen is working on, it will work with IBM to build the unique tools needed to best serve Indian language speakers.

item.title: Building software for quantum-centric supercomputing | IBM Quantum Computing Blog
item.description: Explore open-source tools that IBM and its partners are creating to enable seamless integrations of quantum and classical high-performance computing resources.

item.title: Improving AI agent reliability with BeeAI
item.description: The RequirementAgent from the BeeAI Framework is an innovative approach that provides the reliability needed for production scenarios made simple.

item.title: Register for the new Qiskit v2.X developer certification | IBM Quantum Computing Blog
item.description: Updated Qiskit developer certification exam tests your ability to perform essential quantum computing tasks with the latest version of Qiskit.

item.title: IBM researchers win prestigious European grants
item.description: Ghazi Sarwat Syed and Gregor Seiler add to IBM Research’s strong history with European Research Council grants.
